title: University Programs to Show 'Green Book' on Tuesday
text:
University Programs to Show 'Green Book' on Tuesday

UA Productions Staff

University Programs will show the movie Green Book (PG-13) at 7 p.m. Tuesday, Feb. 18, in the University Programs Video Theater (ARKU 423) on the fourth floor of the Arkansas Union. Admission is free and there will be popcorn and treats provided! This is the second film of University Programs' Black History Month Movie Series.

Green Book stars an award-winning cast including Viggo Mortensen and Oscar-winning Mahershala Ali. Green Book is based on the true story of world-class African-American pianist Dr. Don Shirley and his journey through the racially divided Deep South at the peak of the civil rights movement. A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver of an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South. (IMDb description)

This event is sponsored by University Programs through the Office of Student Activities and is supported by the Student Activities Fee. For questions or for accommodations due to disability please contact the Office of Student Activities, osa@uark.edu or call 479-575-5255. University Programs is a program in the Division of Student Affairs.

About the Division of Student Affairs: The Division of Student Affairs supports students in pursuing knowledge, earning a degree, finding meaningful careers, exploring diversity, and connecting with the global community. We provide students housing, dining, health care resources, and create innovative programs that educate and inspire. We enhance the University of Arkansas experience and help students succeed, one student at a time.
